intro: Tussilago corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered lungwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It is known for its medicinal properties, historically used to treat respiratory ailments. Tussilago corymbosa plays a role in supporting pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
